availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel B. Lashbrook (Daviess County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer. Daviess County, Kentucky, native. Son of Samuel Lashbrook and Martha Brashear Lashbrook. Married to Altha J. Stevens Lashbrook on May 20, 1852. Father of Finley Black Lashbrook and Jane D. Esther Lashbrook. Married to Missouri D. Prather Lashbrook in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on September 4, 1856. Father of Altha C. Lashbrook, Wilbur E. Lashbrook, and Morris E. Lashbrook. Farmer in Daviess County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Daviess County in 1850. Farmer in Daviess County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 440B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 415.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 837.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994039, Hopkins County Marriages, p. 5.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Daviess County Administrators Bonds, 1883-1895, p. 21.
History of Daviess County, Kentucky (Chicago: Inter-State Publishing Co., 1883), 742.
